title: Update Mixpanel tracking snippet token in frontend/index.html

requirements.summary: Replace the Mixpanel snippet in frontend/index.html with the exact user-provided script content and init configuration, keeping it inside <head> right before </head>, while preserving other analytics snippets.
acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html contains exactly one Mixpanel snippet in the <head>.
The Mixpanel snippet includes mixpanel.init('da58e366649ab3a9c5b1fc49681f9d76', { autocapture: true, record_sessions_percent: 100, }) (i.e., the placeholder token 'YOUR_PROJECT_TOKEN' is replaced).
The Mixpanel snippet remains loaded globally for the entire app (i.e., included in frontend/index.html, not per-route).
The app builds and loads without console errors caused by the Mixpanel snippet.

file_operations.description: Update the existing Mixpanel tracking script block to match the exact snippet content provided by the user, including calling mixpanel.init('da58e366649ab3a9c5b1fc49681f9d76', { autocapture: true, record_sessions_percent: 100, }) and ensuring there is exactly one Mixpanel snippet placed in the <head> right before the closing </head> tag. Keep the existing Google Analytics, Microsoft Clarity (tag vc3rnks6lt), Contentsquare, and Smartlook snippets intact and present, and ensure the app builds/loads without Mixpanel-related console errors.
